t3 and t4g Neptune Instance Types Information

t3 is an instance type family.
t4g is an instance type family.
The t3 family of instances offers a low-cost option for getting started using a graph database.
The t4g family of instances offers a low-cost option for getting started using a graph database.
The t3 family of instances offers a low-cost option for initial development and testing.
The t4g family of instances offers a low-cost option for initial development and testing.
The t3 instances are eligible for the Neptune free-tier offer.
The t4g instances are eligible for the Neptune free-tier offer.
The Neptune free-tier offer lets new customers use Neptune at no cost for the first 750 instance hours used within a standalone AWS account or rolled up underneath an AWS Organization with Consolidated Billing (Payer Account).
The t3 instances are only offered in the medium size configuration.
The t4g instances are only offered in the medium size configuration.
t3.medium is a medium size configuration of t3 instances.
t4g.medium is a medium size configuration of t4g instances.
The t3 instances are not intended for use in a production environment.
The t4g instances are not intended for use in a production environment.
The t3 instances have very constrained resources.
The t4g instances have very constrained resources.
The t3 instances are not recommended for testing query execution time because these instances have very constrained resources.
The t4g instances are not recommended for testing query execution time because these instances have very constrained resources.
The t3 instances are not recommended for testing overall database performance because these instances have very constrained resources.
The t4g instances are not recommended for testing overall database performance because these instances have very constrained resources.
To assess query performance, upgrade to one of the other instance families.
